member.summary: Interface, that must be supported by lexem configurations. It describes behaviour of the lexem, that can be collapsed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.IsCollapsable
member.summary: GET checks wheather this config supports collapsing.
member.remarks: If lexem is not collapsabe, all other properties does not have any influence to it`s behaviour.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.IsCollapseAutoNamed
member.summary: GET flag, that specifies, wheather lexem can read it`s text from sub-lexems.

remarks.para: If this property is false, then CollapseName will be used to name the region.

Note: you should know that is this property is true, then on by-lexem reading you`ll have to wait while sub-lexems will be loaded, then processed by RegEx and only then you`ll have your collapsable lexem.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.AutoNameTemplate
member.summary: Template of resulting text for auto-naming of collapse.
member.remarks: To specifie "$" symbol you must use $$. To use result of some named group, use ${name}.

member.summary: Regular expression instance for AutoNameExpression.

member.summary: Name of the collapsed region.
member.remarks: If is true, then this property`s value will be used just when found name is empty.

member.summary: Template of resulting text for auto-naming of collapse.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.ConfigLexem.AutoNameRegex
member.summary: Regular expression instance for AutoNameExpression.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.ConfigLexem.IsCollapseAutoNamed
member.summary: GET flag, that specifies, wheather lexem can read it`s text from sub-lexems.

remarks.para: If this property is false, then CollapseName will be used to name the region.

Note: you should know that is this property is true, then on by-lexem reading you`ll have to wait while sub-lexems will be loaded, then processed by RegEx and then only then you`ll have your collapsable lexem.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.ConfigLexem.CollapseName
member.summary: Name of the collapsed region.
member.remarks: If is true, then this property`s value will be used just when found name is empty.

member.summary: Regex group names prefix.

member.summary: Table of configuration parts, grouped by priorities. Key - Priority. Value - OnePriorityConfigs instance.

member.summary: Lexem Configuration, the keeper is related to.

member.summary: Hashtable of the configs for token, already known.

member.summary: Adds configuration to the hashtable.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.#ctor(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.IConfigLexem)
member.summary: Creates and initializes new instance of the class by config`s data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.GetConfigs(System.String)
member.summary: Looks for lexem configuration by the token.
member.remarks: Search process is entirely based on rules, specified by owner lexem configuration. If owner is complex, search is done within it`s sub-lexems first, then it is done for it`s parent and so on. If there is no appropriate configuration for given token found, languages configuration is used, or the configuration of the first parent with "OnlyLocalSubLexems" set to true.
member.returns: Lexem configuration for given token.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.OnePriorityConfigs
member.summary: Structure, used to keep information about one priority.

member.summary: Hashtable of non-regex lexem configs. Key - string, value - IConfigLexem or ICollection.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.OnePriorityConfigs.GroupedRegExps
member.summary: Regular expression, that contains all reg-exps.

member.summary: Hash table of the regular expression groups. Key - Group name, value - IConfigLexem or ICollection.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx
member.summary: Special wrapper which allow us to control access to stream and cache data. Our implementation fix bug of NET BufferedStream class: on Position property set class reset internal cache. Our class detect situations when reset of cache not needed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._DefaultBufferSize
member.summary: Default buffer allocation size

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._s
member.summary: Underlying stream. Close sets _s to null.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._buffer
member.summary: Shared read/write buffer. Alloc on first use.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._readPos
member.summary: Read pointer within shared buffer.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._readLen
member.summary: Number of bytes read in buffer from _s.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._writePos
member.summary: Write pointer within shared buffer.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._bufferSize
member.summary: Length of internal buffer, if it's allocated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._streamPos
member.summary: Stream position on moment of buffer read

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. hidden to class users.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initialize class by stream and DefaultBufferSize == 4096.
member.param: Stream which our class must wrap

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize class by instance of stream and user defined cache size
member.param: Stream which our class must wrap
member.exception: stream does not support Read and Write operations
bufferSize is equel or less of zero

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read data from stream. If data is cached then class will not call wrapped stream and simple returned copy of cached data.
member.param: offset in output buffer where data from stream must be placed
count of bytes which class must return
member.returns: quantity of read bytes

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the underlying stream. Returns the byte cast to an int or -1 if reading from the end of the stream.
member.returns: read byte

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write portion of data into wrapped stream. If data can be placed into cache then it will be there and only on Flush operation data will be saved to wrapped stream.
member.param: offset to the beginning of the portion of data
number of bytes in the portion of data
member.exception: If array or stream is null
If offset or count is less than zero
If array does not contain required elements count

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Write on byte of information into stream.
member.exception: If stream is null
If can't write into stream

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seek operation. On any seek operation not written data from cache will be flushed to wrapped stream. Better use Position property it optimized for cache use.
member.returns: Current position
member.exception: If stream is null
If can't seek in the stream

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Close
member.summary: Save all data from cache and Close stream.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Flush
member.summary: Flush data. reset cache.
member.exception: When stream is null

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.FlushRead
member.summary: Reading is done by blocks from the file, but someone could read 1 byte from the buffer then write. At that point, the OS's file pointer is out of sync with the stream's position. All write functions should call this function to preserve the position in the file.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.FlushWrite
member.summary: Writes are buffered. Anytime the buffer fills up (_writePos + delta > _bufferSize) or the buffer switches to reading and there is dirty data (_writePos > 0), this function must be called.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set length of wrapped stream
member.exception: When value is less than zero
When stream is null
If can't seek or can't write into stream

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanRead
member.summary: Indicate can be data readed from wrapped stream. TRUE - data can be readed.
member.exception: class instance was disposed

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanWrite
member.summary: Indicate can data be written to wrapped stream.
member.exception: class instance was disposed

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicate does wrapped stream support Seek operations or not
member.exception: class instance was disposed

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Length
member.summary: Get Length of wrapped stream. On property value get class Flush not written to stream data.
member.exception: class instance was disposed

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Position
member.summary: Get current position of stream. Position can be differ then wrapped stream has, because wrapped stream will point on last byte of our cached data. On property set not written data flushed to stream.
member.exception: class instance was disposed
wrapped stream does not support seek operation

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.BaseStream
member.summary: Get reference on stream wrapped by BufferStreamEx

member.remarks: If it can not be found (it is in virtual space), then you will get parse point, pointing to the beginning of the next line. If it can not be done, ParsePoint, pointing to the end of current line will be returned.

Column index, the ParsePoint is needed for. Can be 0.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI
member.summary: Summary description for Native.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.#ctor
member.summary: Hide default constructor

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.CreateCaret(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The CreateCaret function creates a new shape for the system caret and assigns ownership of the caret to the specified window. The caret shape can be a line, a block, or a bitmap.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret.

[in] Handle to the bitmap that defines the caret shape. If this parameter is NULL, the caret is solid. If this parameter is (HBITMAP) 1, the caret is gray. If this parameter is a bitmap handle, the caret is the specified bitmap. The bitmap handle must have been created by the CreateBitmap, CreateDIBitmap, or LoadBitmap function. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores the nWidth and nHeight parameters; the bitmap defines its own width and height.

in] Specifies the width of the caret in logical units. If this parameter is zero, the width is set to the system-defined window border width. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores this parameter

[in] Specifies the height, in logical units, of the caret. If this parameter is zero, the height is set to the system-defined window border height. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores this parameter
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.DestroyCaret
member.summary: The DestroyCaret function destroys the caret's current shape, frees the caret from the window, and removes the caret from the screen.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetCaretBlinkTime
member.summary: Returns the time required to invert the caret's pixels. The user can set this value.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the blink time, in milliseconds. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetCaretPos(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.POINT@)
member.summary: The GetCaretPos function copies the caret's position to the specified POINT structure
member.param: [out] Pointer to the POINT structure that is to receive the client coordinates of the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.HideCaret(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The HideCaret function removes the caret from the screen. Hiding a caret does not destroy its current shape or invalidate the insertion point.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret. If this parameter is NULL, HideCaret searches the current task for the window that owns the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.SetCaretBlinkTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the caret blink time to the specified number of milliseconds. The blink time is the elapsed time, in milliseconds, required to invert the caret's pixels.
member.param: [in] Specifies the new blink time, in milliseconds.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.SetCaretPos(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: moves the caret to the specified coordinates. If the window that owns the caret was created with the CS_OWNDC class style, then the specified coordinates are subject to the mapping mode of the device context associated with that window
member.param: [in] Specifies the new x-coordinate of the caret.
[in] Specifies the new y-coordinate of the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.ShowCaret(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Makes the caret visible on the screen at the caret's current position. When the caret becomes visible, it begins flashing automatically
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret. If this parameter is NULL, ShowCaret searches the current task for the window that owns the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetLastError
member.summary: Retrieves the calling thread's last-error code value. The last-error code is maintained on a per-thread basis. Multiple threads do not overwrite each other's last-error code.
member.returns: The return value is the calling thread's last-error code value. Functions set this value by calling the SetLastError function. The Return Value section of each reference page notes the conditions under which the function sets the last-error code.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl
member.summary: Defines a base class for custom controls that support scrolling behavior.
member.remarks:
The ScrollControl class acts as a base class for controls that require the ability to scroll. To allow a control to display scroll bars as needed, set the AutoScroll property to true. To select which scroll bars should be visible, set the VScroll and HScroll properties.
You can also associate stand-alone scrollbars with the ScrollControl. The VertScrollBar and HorizScrollBar properties allow you to associate external scrollbars. This is of benefit if you want to share one scrollbar with a parent control. For example, if the ScrollControl is a view inside a workbook or dynamic splitter frame.
ScrollControl supports automatic scrolling when the user drags the mouse. In a grid when the user starts selecting cells the user can drag the mouse outside the grid area and the grid will automatically scroll. To enable auto scrolling, override the OnMouseDown event in your dervied control and intialize the AutoScrolling, AutoScrollBounds and InsideScrollBounds properties.
When the user scrolls your control and holds down the mouse on the down or up arrow of the scrollbar, the scrolling speed will accelerate.
The FixRenderOrigin method will ensure correct initialization of the rendering origin for brushes and patterns. You can call FixRenderOrigin from your control's OnPaint method. ScrollControl supports scrolling with the mouse wheel and also cooperates fine with with the IntelliMouseDragScroll class.
If you want to provide context information about your control and change the cursor on the fly while the user moves the mouse, set the OverrideCursor property to the cursor you want to show. Instead you can also implement IMouseController and add the object to MouseControllerDispatcher.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Suspends the painting of the control until the method is called.
member.remarks: When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.BeginUpdate(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.BeginUpdateOptions)
member.summary: Suspends the painting of the control until the method is called.
member.param: Specifies the painting support during the BeginUpdate, EndUpdate batch.
member.remarks:
When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.
Pass BeginUpdateOptions if you do not want to do a complete Refresh of the control and instead want to have certain regions of your control be invalidated or scroll the contents of control. If you call BeginUpdate() and then later EndUpdate() the control will know if a paint is pending and only refresh the control if a paint is pending. Either call to ShouldPrepareUpdate, Invalidate or a WM_PAINT message during the BeginUpdate EndUpdate block will signal the control that a paint is pending.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.ScrollWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scrolls the contents of the control similar to the ScrollWindow Windows API.
member.remarks:
The method will raise a WindowScrolling event before the contents are scrolled and a WindowScrolled event after the contents have been scrolled.
If DisableScrollWindow is true any calls to the ScrollWindow method will simply invalidate the affect region. The rendering origin will still be recorded correctly and WindowScrolling and WindowScrolled events will be raised.
If DisableScrollWindow is false ScrollWindow will scroll the contents of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.EnsurePaintCodeJitted(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method checks if the control is visible, a window handle has been created and if it has not been drawn before, it calls .
member.param: Set this true if you want to force a call to even if the control is not visible and/or no window handle has been created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.DiscardPaintMessagesAfterBeginUpdate
member.summary: When you call BeginUpdate() the control by default does not handle WM_PAINT messages. Only once you call EndUpdate they will be processed. If this causes problems in your application, you can set this static property to true. In such cases WM_PAINT messages will be simply discarded and any invalid regions will be validated.
member.remarks:
There is a problem with the default implementation of BeginUpdate. If a screen region is marked invalid the WndProc will be repeatedly called with WM_PAINT at the the top of the WndProc until EndUpdate is called. This can cause your application to freeze if another window gets created or if you make a web service call and WndProc messages need to be processed.
Setting DiscardPaintMessagesAfterBeginUpdate = true will help avoid these scenarios.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager
member.summary: Provides a global hook for exceptions that have been catched inside the framework and gives you the option to provide specialized handling of the exception. You can also temporarily suspend and resume catching exceptions.
member.remarks:
The Syncfusion framework notifies about exceptions that are catched by calling or .
The method will raise the event. By handling the event your code can analyze the exception that was catched and optionally let it bubble up by rethrowing the exception.
Your code can also temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. This is usefull if you want to provide your own exception handling. Just call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.
You also have the options to disable catching exceptions alltogether by setting to true.
Note: All static settings for this class are thread local.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.SuspendCatchExceptions
member.summary: Temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. Call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.ResumeCatchExceptions
member.summary: Temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. Call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.ShouldCatchExceptions
member.summary: Determines if exceptions should be catched or if they should bubble up. calls this method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.PassThroughExceptions
member.summary: Lets you disable catching exceptions alltogether by setting to true.
